reviews.text:
Good experience!
We booked in advance but we were late, we called them and they kept our table with no problem:)

As soon as we entered we saw a couple dancing a traditional dance in the traditional clothes. It was very nice and atmospheric.

Our waiter (a young blond guy) was very nice. He gave advices about some dishes as we couldn’t choose. He was very kind and smiley.

We took 3 different meat dishes and all of them were very good and tasty. The meat was tender; the apple strudel - fine.

Nice place, no bad vibes

A typical Romanian restaurant located in the heart of downtown Bucharest. The waitstaff were very friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. The food was good, and the service was quick. One small detail to note: if you order a glass of a specific wine, it would be better if the waiters brought the bottle to the table to pour the wine, rather than taking the glass away and returning with it already served.
The price is reasonable for the food. Portions are big and definitely a place to come back. We had starters, two mains and dessert with non alcoholic drinks and it was about €70-ish

The three of us visited for lunch and it was not busy at all despite it being located closer to the touristy Old Town. Our waiter was very attentive and extremely friendly and helpful. We had the fried chicken steamed with potato wedges and garlic, the pork ribs with polenta and the grilled chicken with potatoes. All food was delivered promptly and the flavours were fantastic. If you love garlic and traditional Romanian food, this is a stop that should not be missed. I would definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

This restaurant was recommended by my hotel. It provided a delicious dining experience that I enjoyed twice during my stay. The food was delicious. My only criticism is that the restaurant aggressively pushes for tips, which was a negative aspect of an otherwise pleasant experience.
